com.threecrickets.prudence
Class DelegatedStatusService

java.lang.Object
  org.restlet.service.Service
      org.restlet.service.StatusService
          com.threecrickets.prudence.DelegatedStatusService

public class DelegatedStatusService
extends StatusService

Allows delegating the handling of errors to specified restlets.

Author:
Tal Liron
See Also:

Method Detail

getErrorHandlers

public ConcurrentMap<Integer,Restlet> getErrorHandlers()
A map of error statuses to target restlets. If no handler is mapped for a status, the default handling will kick in. (Modifiable by concurrent threads.)

Returns:
The error handlers

isDebugging

public boolean isDebugging()
Whether we should show debugging information on errors.

Returns:
True if debugging

public void setHandler(int statusCode,
                       Restlet errorHandler)

Parameters:

capture

public void capture(int statusCode,
                    String application,
                    String internalUriTemplate,
                    Context context)
Captures (internally redirects) an error status to a URI within an application. You can use template variables in the URI.

This is handled via a CapturingRedirector with mode Redirector.MODE_SERVER_OUTBOUND.

Parameters:
statusCode - The status code
application - The internal application name
internalUriTemplate - The internal URI template to which we will redirect
context - The context

captureHostRoot

public void captureHostRoot(int statusCode,
                            String application,
                            String internalUriTemplate,
                            Context context)
Captures (internally redirects) an error status to a URI within an application, with the resource reference's base URI being set the host root. You can use template variables in the URI.

This is handled via a CapturingRedirector with mode Redirector.MODE_SERVER_OUTBOUND.

Parameters:
statusCode - The status code
application - The internal application name
internalUriTemplate - The internal URI template to which we will redirect
context - The context

removeHandler

public void removeHandler(int status)
Removes the handler for an error status.

Parameters:
status - The status code
